content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown document `md` with many lines. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer as a NamedTuple with keys `question` and `answer`. For a section to be valid, it must start at the beginning of the line. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text. Provide example.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md)
    questions = []
    answers = []

    for (i, line) in enumerate(eachline(md))
        if startswith(line, "# Question")
            # Start of a new question section
            question_start = i
        elseif startswith(line, "# Answer")
            # Start of an answer to the previous question
            answer_start = i
            while answers == [] && !endswith(line, "# Answer")
                answers = [line]
            end
            # Append the answer with leading spaces stripped
            push!(answers, strip(join(answers)) * "\n")
        elseif startswith(line, "#") && questions == []
            # First line starting with a hash is considered a question
            questions = [line]
        end
    end

    # Collect the last answer if it doesn't end with an Answer header
    if answers != []
        push!(answers, strip(join(answers)) * "\n")
    end

    # Convert to a named tuple
    return (question = join(questions), answer = join(answers))
end

# Example usage:
md_content = read("example.md", String)
result = q_and_a_extractor(md_content)
println(result.question)
println(result.answer)
```

This function will extract all questions and answers from the markdown document `md` and return them as a NamedTuple with keys `:question` and `:answer`. The example usage shows how to read a file into memory, run the function on it, and print the results.
